comments:

Seems as if there is a plug-in leaking image resources somewhere.

I had just the regular ones installed -- old UI not the new one.

As far as I can remember I have used the following views:

Package Explorer, JUnit, Console, Problems, Synchronize view

I used the Java Editor, the Compare Editor, and the regular text editor.

The progress icon was visible several times.
- win98 has a notoriously low limit on the availability of resource handles, 
but this shouldn't happen
- There were various leaks fixed in M6; perhaps you've stumbled onto others 
that were missed
- Taking ownership of report while I do a quick tour with JProbe in the areas 
that you mentioned.  There shouldn't be any swt changes required, but hopefully 
I can log some reports with others.
*** Bug 49448 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
- outstanding report: bug 47739
- new report: bug 49689

still looking...
- new report: bug 49695
new reports: bug 49700 , bug 49714 , bug 49741
more new reports: bug 49744 , bug 49796 , bug 49802 , bug 49803
I've finished looking, so changing report status.  It's quite difficult to do 
an exhaustive search, but these should be most of the resource leaks.  Sleak 
actually proved to be more useful than JProbe for tracking these down.

Something else that this sweep has demonstrated is the huge number of 
resources, Images in particular, that Eclipse can have simultaneous handles to, 
even when it's not leaking.  This could become a constraint for running on 
win98 at all, especially for products like WSAD which live on top of Eclipse 
and may contribute 100's of additional images.  Will keep on eye on this, and 
may suggest to jface to no longer hold on to images whose reference count has 
reached 0.
Verified in M8.
(In reply to comment #8)
> Verified in M8.

I have THE SAME problem in ECLIPSE 3.1.0, adding 10000 registers to a Table object.
I am working with WIN XP, SP2

Thank you

If you have a specific case that always runs out of handles then please log a bug report with Platform - SWT.  This report is too broad (and old) to reopen for the purposes of investigating a specific scenario.
(In reply to comment #10)
> If you have a specific case that always runs out of handles then please log a
> bug report with Platform - SWT.  This report is too broad (and old) to reopen
> for the purposes of investigating a specific scenario.
> 

Hi. Tanks.

Do I put it here or should I open a new report?  It hapens when the amount of rows is too high. For ex. it does not happens with 1000.

cheers
You can open a new report, but first consider:
- You mention (for example) 10000 rows not working for you; you're not creating 10000 images/fonts/colors are you?  Even XP has a limit on the number of resources that can be simultaneously open.
- Does it still happen with a 3.2-stream build of eclipse (eg.- 3.2M5)?  If it no longer happens then there's nothing to fix.
- Be sure to include a snippet that demonstrates the problem happening; for a base snippet to start with see http://www.eclipse.org/swt/faq.php#whatisasnippet .
